title: Bowlers Shine Bright As India Beat South Africa By 203 Runs In First Test
text:
Indian bowlers made light work of the South Africa batsmen as they proved too strong as India won the first Test by 203 runs.

BCCI

It was also going to be a daunting task - chasing 395 with ball spinning and pitch showing wear and tear. India needed nine wickets on the final day to wrap up the Test match and Ravichandran Ashwin provided the breakthrough early on, as he became the joint fastest to 350 Test wickets.

It was all Mohammed Shami after that as he got three quick fire wickets to leave South Africa reeling at 60 for 5.

Ravindra Jadeja soon joined the party as he dismissed Aiden Markam, Vernon Philander and Keshav Marharaj, very cheaply to leave India on the cusp of victory. With two wickets left, it was only a matter of time before India took the game.

BCCI

But Dane Piedt and Senuran Mathusamy showed great resilience before he chopped on a Shami delivery. The Indian pacer was soon back in the scheme of things as he got Rabada to nick one behind to Saha. It meant South Africa were bowled out for 191.

Shami was the pick of the bunch in the second innings with a five-wicket haul.

A thorough performances with both batsmen and bowlers chipping in. A great start to the series for India, and work to to do for South Africa.
